entry.title: Shanghai Trip 2025 - Day 1
entry.content:
International Labor Day! Finally, this long-anticipated vacation has arrived. Before it started, I was actually thinking Iâ€™d just stay home, do some programming, or play Minecraft during the break.

About two weeks before the holiday, Yuxi told me he will go to visit his sister in Shanghai. When I got that message, I felt a little sad. If he was going to Shanghai, we probably wouldnâ€™t get to hang out much during the vacation.

I considered tagging along, but I had already visited Shanghai last summer with Eric (see Shanghai Trip 2024). It didnâ€™t seem like a good idea to travel to the same place again so soon.

At first, I thought Iâ€™d just stay home. But Shanghai left me with such great memories that, in the endâ€”on a bit of an impulseâ€”I DECIDED TO GOOOOOOOOO WITH HIM!!

We got home from boring school on the last day of April, played Minecraft together, and defeated the Ender Dragon. Then on May 1st, we met up with some of our old classmates and had a lot of fun.

Yuxi and I were classmates in junior high. We spent three of the most memorable, emotional, and unforgettable years of our lives together.


After dinner, Yuxi and I began our journey to Shanghai.

A funny story happened on the plane.
I was already exhausted after going through the security check and walking all the way to our gate. Once we boarded, I felt super thirsty. As we all know, liquids canâ€™t be brought on the plane, so I didnâ€™t have anything left to drink. I asked the flight attendant for some water. A kind lady brought me a cup, but it wasnâ€™t enoughâ€”I asked for another. She brought a second. Still not enough! I asked again and she handed me a third cup. ðŸ˜‚ In total, I drank five cups of water and at one point had three cups in my hand. When she passed me the third cup, the passenger sitting next to me started laughing.


We landed at Shanghai Pudong International Airport at 10:40 PM. I finished writing this post just now.

Technically, this is our first day in Shanghai, although we will stay in Shanghai for only 1 hour todat since we arrived so late.

Tomorrow, we plan to visit the Gundam statue. After that, weâ€™ll probably explore more around the city.

Itâ€™s my first time traveling with such a cherished classmateâ€”I hope there will be many more trips like this in the future. ðŸ˜­

entry.title: Why did I create this website?
entry.content:

I have created a Chinese-only blog since October 2023. As of late April 2025, that blog has reached almost 40k views in total.

My Chinese-only blog is called mao mao de meng, which means Maomaoâ€™s Dream. Maomao is my Chinese nickname, like my English nickname Mars. Maomaoâ€™s Dream appeared in my mind when I was taking a shower while I was struggling to name my first live website. It represents my dream of having it.
Visit Maomaoâ€™s Dream (www.maodream.com)

As time came to 2025, Iâ€™ve started trying to socialize with friends from all over the world. I do have some foreign friends before, but only several and we hardly talk.

I remember it was a cool afternoon, I skipped school on that day since i wasnâ€™t feeling well. I was really bored and decided to try to make my first step into a brand-new zone.

I joined the official Discord server of CubeCraft, which is a Minecraft server I liked. There were some people in the voice channel. I taped join, started greeting and introducing myself, things began to change.

I had a lot of fun with my new friends SHPINAT, Soham and FELLGETS, later I met XY and Iris. I also built my first international Discord server.

I have many chinese friends obviously, and I have a Chinese-only blog as I mentioned before. But I have never tried to build an international website. Basically, thatâ€™s why I create Mars Inside.

For this brand-new blog, Iâ€™ll keep writing and sharing my stories and experiences, also interesting things.
